questions.question: What is another name for the mistletoebird?
Where is the mistletoebird NOT native to in Australia?
What is the primary food of the mistletoebird?
How can the male mistletoebird be distinguished from the female?
options: The male has an orange-pink bill.
The male is dark grey above with a white throat.
The male is glossy blue-black above with a red chest.
The male and female look exactly the same.
questions.answer: The male is glossy blue-black above with a red chest.

questions.question: Where was the male mistletoebird photographed according to the text?
options: Round Hill Nature Reserve in New South Wales, Australia
questions.answer: Round Hill Nature Reserve in New South Wales, Australia
